H0.text: To digest food is the primary function of the excretory system, as the human body is composed of different systems made of specialized cells, tissues, and organs, each with a specific function that aids in the survival of the human species.

H1.text: The primary function of the excretory system, one of the specialized systems in the human body made of cells, tissues, and organs that aid survival, is to help in defense.

H2.text: To eliminate waste is the primary function of the excretory system, one of the human bodyâ€™s systems made of specialized cells, tissues, and organs that aid in survival.

H3.text: To enable movement is the primary function of the excretory system, a component of the human body composed of specialized cells, tissues, and organs.

A4.text: The dual function of excretory systems is the elimination of the waste products of metabolism and to drain the body of used up and broken down components in a liquid and gaseous state.

A5.text: The excretory system is a passive biological system that removes excess, unnecessary materials from the body fluids of an organism, so as to help maintain internal chemical homeostasis and prevent damage to the body.
